com.github.rholder.fauxflake

Class BackwardsTimeException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • com.github.rholder.fauxflake.BackwardsTimeException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class BackwardsTimeException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException
    BackwardsTimeException is thrown when backwards time is detected. The offset should indicate how many milliseconds to wait before trying again in the present.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor for propagating a detailed message and time offset.

      long getOffset()
      Return the number of milliseconds from the time the Exception occurred and the present time.
